channel.title: How do you add a ::interface # command for 718?
channel.description: Well, I've been searching for something like the above for a while, and i couldn't find anything, maybe i'm not searching for the right thing. If someone could lead me to the right way, that would be nice...

item.title: How do you add a ::interface # command for 718?
item.dc:creator: @bananastreet bananastreet
item.description:
@bananastreet wrote:

Docent:

can you post a command that was in the source you were using? I’d prefer an object or npc spawning command

DUDE I GOT IT!!!

if (cmd[0].equals("interface")) { player.getInterfaceManager().sendInterface(Integer.valueOf(cmd[1])); return true; }

Read full topic
item.source: How do you add a ::interface # command for 718?

item.title: How do you add a ::interface # command for 718?
item.dc:creator: @bananastreet bananastreet
item.description:
@bananastreet wrote:

Docent:

When the compiler says “cannot find symbol” its basically saying it cannot find a method or in that case, an array.

Well… i attempted and got this far, and i still can’t get it to work, tried my best with my knowledge.

if (cmd[0].equals("interface")) { player.getInterfaceManager().sendInterface(Integer.parseInt(cmd[0])); return true; }

Read full topic
item.source: How do you add a ::interface # command for 718?

item.source: How do you add a ::interface # command for 718?

item.title: How do you add a ::interface # command for 718?
item.dc:creator: @bananastreet bananastreet
item.description:
@bananastreet wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:10, topic:529543”][quote author=bananastreet link=topic=648296.msg4360872#msg4360872 date=1378692946]

Then get some basic knowledge and then begin working on a private server.

That sounded kinda rude, but i guess you are right, i cant be fed the answers and expect to learn anything.

I was not trying to be rude. I just relate to you. I literally started java programming about 2 months or something ago. Now look at what I am able to do. Its not hard to learn and it is really worth it. I was just like you lollygagging into the world of RSPS not knowing anything about how java or servers work. But a little dedication really paid off.

You recommend anywhere to start for beginners like me?
[/quote]

I can tell you how I started…

First: I went on a website called Udemy and bought the Beginners Java course. I went through the entire thing.

Second: I got a 377 private server and tried to read the code. If I didn’t know what something was, I asked my dad. If your dad isn’t a programmer, use the internet.

Third: I mimicked previous code in the server to add my own content. For example if the code for a command teleported me somewhere, I rewrote that code and just changed the variables.

Fourth: I looked at in depth content adding tutorials and snippets found all over the internet. They usually explain a lot of things.

Fifth: With some basic knowledge, I now began working on my 2006 Remake.

Sixth: I am still writing more and more code and making everything more complex just to see if I run into an issue so that I can solve it.[/quote]

Yeah, I’m not that lucky to have a dad like that, i might get some lessons and look at some books or something, and i started fixing the command.
and got this little problem that’s stumping me.
I seen something like that before… but i don’t think in a 718.

starting...
src\com\rs\game\player\content\commands\RegularPlayer.java:37: error: cannot fin
d symbol
                                sendInterface(Integer.parseInt(args[0]));
                                                               ^
  symbol:   variable args
  location: class RegularPlayer

Read full topic
item.source: How do you add a ::interface # command for 718?

item.title: How do you add a ::interface # command for 718?
item.dc:creator: @Docent Limits
item.description:
@Docent wrote:

[quote=“bananastreet, post:9, topic:529543”][quote author=Docent link=topic=648296.msg4360869#msg4360869 date=1378692778]

Then get some basic knowledge and then begin working on a private server.

That sounded kinda rude, but i guess you are right, i cant be fed the answers and expect to learn anything.

I was not trying to be rude. I just relate to you. I literally started java programming about 2 months or something ago. Now look at what I am able to do. Its not hard to learn and it is really worth it. I was just like you lollygagging into the world of RSPS not knowing anything about how java or servers work. But a little dedication really paid off.
[/quote]

You recommend anywhere to start for beginners like me?[/quote]

I can tell you how I started…

First: I went on a website called Udemy and bought the Beginners Java course. I went through the entire thing.

Second: I got a 377 private server and tried to read the code. If I didn’t know what something was, I asked my dad. If your dad isn’t a programmer, use the internet.

Third: I mimicked previous code in the server to add my own content. For example if the code for a command teleported me somewhere, I rewrote that code and just changed the variables.

Fourth: I looked at in depth content adding tutorials and snippets found all over the internet. They usually explain a lot of things.

Fifth: With some basic knowledge, I now began working on my 2006 Remake.

Sixth: I am still writing more and more code and making everything more complex just to see if I run into an issue so that I can solve it.

Read full topic

item.title: How do you add a ::interface # command for 718?
item.dc:creator: @bananastreet bananastreet
item.description:
@bananastreet wrote:

[quote=“Docent, post:2, topic:529543”]Hmm.

if (keyword.equals(“interface”)) {
actionSender.sendInterface(Integer.parseInt(args[0]));
}[/quote]

starting... src\com\rs\game\player\content\commands\RegularPlayer.java:36: error: cannot fin d symbol if (keyword.equals("interface")) { ^ symbol: variable keyword location: class RegularPlayer src\com\rs\game\player\content\commands\RegularPlayer.java:37: error: cannot fin d symbol actionSender.sendInterface(Integer.parseInt(args [0])); ^ symbol: variable args location: class RegularPlayer src\com\rs\game\player\content\commands\RegularPlayer.java:37: error: cannot fin d symbol actionSender.sendInterface(Integer.parseInt(args [0])); ^ symbol: variable actionSender location: class RegularPlayer 3 errors

Read full topic
